title: 108_hr4066
content:
The Act titled "Chickasaw National Recreation Area Land Exchange Act of 2004" is established for the purpose of exchanging land. Congress finds that in 1902, 640 acres of land were ceded to create Sulphur Springs Reservation, later known as Platt National Park. In 1976, Platt National Park and other lands were combined to form Chickasaw National Recreation Area to protect resources and honor Chickasaw Nation's history. The Chickasaw Nation now seeks to establish a cultural center within or near the park. The Chickasaw National Recreation Area's Final Amendment to the General Management Plan (1994) identified the best location for a proposed Chickasaw Nation Cultural Center within the existing boundary. The City of Sulphur, Oklahoma, donated land to the Chickasaw Nation for a land exchange with the United States, conveying fee simple title to Tract 102-26. The National Park Service, Chickasaw Nation, and City of Sulphur, Oklahoma have agreed to a land exchange for building a cultural center. The purpose of this agreement is to facilitate and expedite the land conveyance according to the terms of the Act. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS.

    Definitions for the Act:
        - Federal land: Chickasaw National Recreational Area lands, Tract 102-25 on the Map.
        - Non-federal land: Former City of Sulphur lands, now owned by Chickasaw Nation, Tract 102-26 on the Map.
        - Map: Proposed Land Exchange and Boundary Revision map, dated September 8, 2003.
        - Secretary: Secretary of the Interior.

SEC. 4. CHICKASAW NATIONAL RECREATION AREA LAND CONVEYANCE. The Chickasaw Nation will convey non-Federal land to the United States, and in return, the Secretary will convey Federal land to the Chickasaw Nation. The fair market values of both lands will be determined by an appraisal meeting Federal standards, and any differences in value will be equalized through cash payments. Upon completion of the land exchange, the Secretary will revise the boundary of Chickasaw National Recreation Area. The conveyance of non-Federal land is subject to conditions outlined in the Preliminary Exchange Agreement, with an exception for Federal land trust for the Chickasaw Nation. Upon completion of the land exchange, the Secretary shall revise the boundary of Chickasaw National Recreation Area to reflect the exchange and administer the acquired land in accordance with laws and regulations.
